stanza.line: Or I shall live your epitaph tomake
Or you survive when I in earth amrotten
From hence your memory death cannottake
Although in me each part will beforgotten
Your name from hence immortal life shall have
Though I once gone to all the world mustdie
The earth can yield me but a common grave
When you entombed in men eyes shalllie
Your monument shall be my gentleverse
Which eyes not yet created shall oerread
And tongues to be your being shallrehearse
When all the breathers of this world aredead
You still shall live such virtue hath mypen
Where breath most breathes even in the mouths ofmen
